p.s: Description of Shewanella japonica sp. nov.
Shewanella japonica (ja.po'ni.ca. N.L. adj. japonica Japanese, pertaining to the Sea of Japan)
Cells are rod-shaped, 1-2 μm in length and 0.6-0.8 μm in diameter, polarly flagellated and Gram-negative, facultatively anaerobic heterotrophs.
Anaerobic growth occurs by fermentation of D-glucose by anaerobic respiration of nitrate.
Ferric compounds cannot serve as electron donors.
No endospores are formed.
Colonies on marine 2216 agar are circular, smooth and convex with an entire edge, slightly pinkish.
Organic growth factors and sodium ions or sea water are not required.
Does not grow at NaCl concentrations above 3%.
Temperature range for growth is 10-37 °C, with optimum growth at 20-25 °C.
No growth detected at 40 °C.
The pH range for growth is 6.0-9.0, with optimum growth at pH 7.5.
Oxidase- and catalase-positive.
Cytotoxic and haemolytic.
Exhibits amylase, alginase, agarase, gelatinase, κ-carrageenase, DNase, L-aminarinase and lipase activities.
Chitin and elastin are not hydrolysed.
Susceptible to gentamycin, carbenicillin, lincomycin and oleandomycin.
Utilizes galactose, fructose, maltose, N-acetylglucosamine, succinate, xylose, glucose, acetate, D-glucosamine, pyruvate and cellobiose as sole sources of carbon.

D-Mannose, sucrose, lactose, melibiose, D-gluconate, fumarate, citrate, aconitate, meso-erythritol, D-mannitol, glycerol, γ-aminobutyrate, L-tyrosine, D-sorbitol, DL-malate, α-ketoglutarate, trehalose, gluconate and D-aminovalerate are not utilized.
Major cellular fatty acids are i-15:0, 16:0 and 16: 1(n-7).
Produces eicosapentaenoic acid.
Based on 16S rRNA nucleotide sequence analysis, the strains belong to the γ-Proteobacteria and are members of the genus Shewanella.
Isolated from sea water and the mussel Protothaca jedoensis.
The G­+C content of the DNA 43-44 mol%.
The type strain is KMM 3299T (=LMG 19691T=CIP 106860T).
